action.action-desc: Mr. Yakym (for himself and Mr. Panetta) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To require the Council on Environmental Quality to publish an annual report on environmental reviews and causes of action based on alleged non-compliance with the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Studying NEPA’s Impact on Projects Act.

section.header: Annual report on NEPA’s impact on projects
section.text: Section 201 of the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 (42 U.S.C. 4341) is amended to read as follows:

section.header: Annual report on NEPA’s impact on projects

subsection.text: Beginning July 1, 2025, the Council on Environmental Quality shall annually publish on the website of the Council on Environmental Quality, and submit to the Committee on Natural Resources of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate, a report on—

paragraph.text: each cause of action based on alleged non-compliance with this Act that was active during the period beginning June 1 of the preceding year and ending June 1 of the current year, which shall identify—

subparagraph.text: with respect to each such cause of action—

clause.text: the defendant lead agency and the lead plaintiff; and
the court in which the cause of action was brought and any court to which a decision on the cause of action was appealed;

subparagraph.text: the number of such causes of action, disaggregated by the defendant lead agency;
the alleged basis for each such cause of action, disaggregated by type; and

the status and outcome, if applicable, of each cause of action based on alleged non-compliance with this Act that was active during the period beginning June 1 of the preceding year and ending June 1 of the current year, including whether—

clause.text: the cause of action resulted in the major Federal action being reversed;
the defendant lead agency was allowed to move forward with the major Federal action;
the court issued a ruling directing the defendant lead agency to take additional measures to be in compliance;
the lead plaintiff and the defendant lead agency settled amongst themselves;
the cause of action is still active; and
the lead plaintiff received an award, including an award of costs pursuant to section 2412 of title 28, United States Code;

paragraph.text: the length of environmental impact statements and environmental assessments prepared pursuant to section 102(2)(C) during the period of 5 years that ends on June 1 of the current year, which shall include—

subparagraph.text: the average and median page count of each draft and final environmental impact statement and environmental assessment (including the appendix) published in the Federal Register during such period of 5 years, including such page counts disaggregated by quartiles;

the number of draft and final environmental impact statements and environmental assessments published in the Federal Register during such period of 5 years, disaggregated by defendant lead agency and subagency as applicable; and

a description of trends in average and median page count of draft and final environmental impact statements and environmental assessments published in the Federal Register during such period of 5 years compared to prior reports published by the Council on Environmental Quality;

paragraph.text: the total cost to prepare the environmental impact statements and environmental assessments described in paragraph (2), including—

subparagraph.text: the full-time equivalent personnel hour costs, contractor costs, and other direct costs of the lead agency that prepared the environmental impact statement or environmental assessment; and
if practicable, and noted where not practicable, the costs incurred by cooperating agencies, participating agencies, applicants, and contractors; and

paragraph.text: the timelines to complete environmental reviews pursuant to section 102(2)(C) during the period of 10 years that ends on June 1 of the current year, which shall include—

subparagraph.text: with respect to each major Federal action commenced during such period of 10 years, the date on which (as applicable)—

clause.text: the project sponsor submitted an application for any permit or other authorization for the project;
the lead agency began the scoping;
the notice of intent to prepare the environmental impact statement was published in the Federal Register;
the draft environmental impact statement was published in the Federal Register;
the final environmental impact statement was published in the Federal Register;
the record of decision was published in the Federal Register; and
the lead agency provided to the project sponsor notice to proceed on the project;

subparagraph.text: the average and median publication timelines during such period of 10 years for each document described in subparagraph (A); and
a description of trends in completion times during such period of 10 years for such documents compared to prior reports published by the Council on Environmental Quality.

paragraph.text: The information included in each report required under subsection (a) shall be disaggregated by the type of project and covered sector.
In this subsection, the term covered sector means any of the following sectors:

subparagraph.text: Any other sector as determined by the Council on Environmental Quality.

subsection.text: The Council on Environmental Quality shall publish with each report published under subsection (a) the underlying data used to prepare each such report and include any citations or other information necessary for the public to locate records related to the court proceedings for any cause of action described in subsection (a)(1).
